name: Restaurant La Tagliatella | Gl√≤ries
review_1:
A very solid Italian restaurant, but manage your expectations.
Is this the best Italian restaurant ever?, no way. Will you get authentic Italian food just like grandma would?, nah!
Is it a solid option for dinner with good portions at a great price?, oh yeah.
review_2: Good quality ingredients and tasty dishes. You can choose the pasta you want and match it with any sauce in the menu. The service is good and well trained. Depending on the day and time you go, it can get very crowded and noisy though.
review_3: Italian restaurant with all verities of pasta and pizzas. I tried vegetarian variant and I liked it. Their quantity of one dish is more for one person. If you don‚Äôt prefer to eat too much then you should share between two.
review_4:
We came to this place without looking at the reviews first and I‚Äôm glad we did so!
Loved the vibe, everyone seemed satisfied. The stuff is very friendly and kind. The food‚Ä¶. Oh the food - we ordered the bread and the risotto and also pasta - it was a pleasure! The dishes were huge and we couldn‚Äôt finish it, it was so tasty though- totally worth the price!!! Definitely recommend.
review_5:
I did visit the Torre Agbar and did shop at the shopping mall near by where this restaurant is. After the shopping i did eat hear.
Good tasting food and fine price but it could be little better. The pizza was Big but too thin. And i did Try a new pizza with a cheese i did know, bot a good choose. The spaghetti with Almind and mushrooms was good but diffecult to eat it all because to much Almond taste.
And no chicken. But i Will still recommend it if you visit the shopping mall.

name: Sports Bar Italian Food
review_1:
Very good Italian food.
Very sporty vibe inside. Actually You can watch sport tv from any seat in a restaurant.
review_2:
I had a lovely Pizza Diavola in the menu. Was only 10‚Ç¨ including drink and dessert. Pizza was true Italian, one of the best ones in Barcelona for sure!
I am not a sports fan, but someone recommended me this place just for the food and i was not dissapointed, really nice! üëå
review_3:
This was unexpectedly good!
I was very sceptical about this place, as I saw it as a sport bar for tourists (a lot of times I was passing by and saw tons of visitors speaking English and french). But this time I decided to give it a try and I‚Äôm so happy I did it
It‚Äôs a nice place run by Italians and the staff is very friendly and welcoming. The only thing that was a bit off for me was that I didn‚Äôt know what to order and my friend made an order very fast, so the staff were bothering me too often, checking every 2 minutes of I decided on what I want to eat üòÑ
These Italian guys are very nice, they tried to give me some recommendations and have a little conversation
We waited for the food about 15 minutes, not more than that and it was pretty tasty. The pizza that I ordered was very big and the thin dough of it was very good. Of course you need to eat it with a fork and knife, I don‚Äôt really know how to roll it, like Italians do
I ordered my favourite Italian dessert that we also have in Ukraine - baba (—Ä–æ–º–æ–≤–∞—è –±–∞–±–∞) and it was one of the best ones that I ever tried abroad. Not only presentation, but also the taste of it was perfect!
The prices here are also very good, that‚Äôs why this place is so popular, I think
It‚Äôs definitely worth a visit ü§ó
review_4: Nice place to go with friends, family or work mates. You have a menu during the week for a bit less than 13 euros. The quality is quite good, and the pizza menu is 10 euros, also tasty. The small things make a difference, for example the coke is a 350ml bottle (big one), and that's difficult to find in restaurants in Barcelona. The service most of the times is so busy and it takes time to get served, however if you're not in a rush, it's perfect.
review_5:
I really cannot emphasize how good the food here was. I ordered the seafood risotto and the lasagna, and I very thoroughly enjoyed both. I think this might have been my favorite risotto that I've ever had!

The place was sports themed-of course- and was more of a restaurant than an actual bar, but it seemed that it had all of the drinks and mixers necessary for anyone that did want to drink. Friendly and helpful staff too! Highly recommend.

name: SiamoQua Ristorante Pizzeria
review_1: The staff here is absolutely amazing, always attentive and friendly. And let's talk about the food ‚Äì it's absolutely delicious! Not to mention, the prices are surprisingly affordable. While they're well-known for their fantastic pizza, I must say that the portion sizes for non-pizza dishes could use a bit more attention. They were a bit on the smaller side. Nonetheless, I highly recommend giving this place a try ‚Äì you won't be disappointed!
review_2:
After Covid-19 the quality of pizza and tiramisu is no longer five star.No.

Before COVID-19 :
The desert was tasty. Great quality coffee.
I loved the homemade tiramisu and the shuffle the chocolate it is worth  to try.
Pizza Norma with additional pepperoni was fantastic as well as pizza barbecue üçïüçïüçï
review_3:
Little piece of Italy inside Spain.

the venue is cozy and very inviting, even though most of the stuff didn't know English very well they were very patient, helpful and  kind.

The pizza was great, a real pizza with fresh tomato sauce made in a brick oven. It was a delightüëå

Pricing is totally fair to the area and most of the pizzas cost under 10 euros. Would come again.
review_4: Very very good food, we enjoyed a lot. We had very good time. Very nice service, we will back
review_5: Favourite place for pasta. So much after 5 years we came back specially for it. Lovely staff, lovely ambience, lovely food

name: Paisano Bistr√≥
editorial_review: An Italian family runs this popular cafe/bistro known for its house special pasta, pizza & brunches.
review_1: Excellent food! We‚Äòve tasted the daily recommendation, lasagna and pizza. All exceptional. The interior is very cosy and warm, with nice details. You might have to wait a bit for a table as it is always crowded. But worth it!
review_2:
Spain üá™üá∏  Barcelona  - restaurants
Paisano Bistr√≥ has undoubtedly earned its reputation as the best Italian restaurant in Barcelona, if not all of Spain.

Despite the wait for an outdoor table, the aromas that wafted through the air only heightened our anticipation for what was to come.

Once seated, we embarked on a culinary adventure that left our taste buds in a state of sheer bliss. I opted for the ravioli, filled with delectable truffle and Italian sausage, bathing in a heavenly white sauce. Each bite was a revelation, with the flavors meticulously balanced and the textures flawlessly executed. I knew I'd think back on this meal for weeks to come and think to myself with nostalgic feelings, "I should call him." An expression normally used for missing an ex somehow seems appropriate for this meal.

My friend had the lasagna, and it was nothing short of extraordinary. The pasta, rich meat sauce, and melted cheese melded together to create a harmonious blend of flavors. It was a classic dish executed with finesse and an undeniable passion for authentic Italian cuisine.

While we had to settle for an outdoor table this time, we have already made a mental note to make reservations for our next visit so we can fully immerse ourselves in the charming and warm interior ambiance.

Paisano Bistr√≥ truly deserves every accolade it receives, and I wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone seeking an unforgettable Italian dining experience in Barcelona. Prepare to surrender your senses to the culinary magic that unfolds within its walls. Whether it's a special occasion or simply a desire for exceptional Italian cuisine, this gem of a restaurant will leave you craving for more.
review_3: Our pasta dishes were hard and undercooked. Made for really unpleasant eating experience having chewy pasta. Felt like a rock in the stomach. Restaurant vibes was cute, romantic and cozy. In my friend's pasta, we found a small, round metal ball clearly kitchen material. We notified staff who took the dish straight to the kitchen, and the blonde chef just shrugged and denied it. The waiter came back saying they didn't know what it was, and the metal ball wasn't from them! Absurd! They gave a replacement dish which was too salty and garlicky. Worst meal in our holiday to Barcelona. Save your money. Avoid.
review_4: Paisano Bistro in Spain offers a delightful experience with great pizza and wine. The setting exudes a good atmosphere, complemented by cool and attentive service. It sounds like a fantastic place to enjoy a meal!
review_5: Eveything was absolutely incredible - the people, the owner, the food, the ambience and the prices were very reasonable. I found this gem of a restaurant through google reviews towards the end of my solo trip so I had the chance to go back twice for lunch. I would honestly eat here every day if I found this sooner. I loved that there was outdoor seating available on this quaint street, great for people watching or to simply read a book. ELMO and DISERIA (?) were so sweet and friendly, they really made me feel at home. I met the owner as I was walking out and complimented him on such a fine establishment and employees, he was equally as sweet. I wanted to try everything on the menu but the eggplant croquette was phenomenal along with the 2 pasta dishes I tried, and the pistachio tiramisu was to die for. I will definately be back when I make a trip back to Barcelona. The service was top notch as well as the food. I cannot boost enough about this restaurant, you really should give it a try. There is no way you would be dissapointed. It is really hard to find a place that delivers on customer experience and food along with affordable prices. Thank you so much for a wonderful experience!

name: Bocca di Bonifacio
review_1:
We came here a work dinner, we were a big group of 35.

The way they work is that you decide the main dish and the desert in advance.

It was the best experience I ever had with group diners and different dishes.
Everything was organized, timed correctly and with no mistakes.

They rock!

The food was also very good.

I can‚Äôt vouch for the price as I‚Äôm not aware of the group dinner prices, but I would for sure recommend this place for group dinners.

Also we had gluten intolerance in our group and vegetarians and all was taken care of.

Really recommend this place
review_2: Food and service is excellent here. Loved the tazmania pizza which is just right level of spiciness. Raviolone is also very nice love the filling in it very delicious but the portion not as filling as the pizza. The burger was quite alright came out medium just right. The brioche bun was soft and fluffy. Finally the drinks especially the barone cocktail was so smoky with citrusy. One of the best cocktails I've had here much better than sangria.
review_3: Very nice Italian restaurant. The pizza is well made and there was even live music being played by two gentlemen!
review_4: Super nice vibe here with live music and fun Italian staff. The meals were all good but the milanesa stole the show.
review_5: Bocca du Bonifaccio has become my go-to restaurant in Barcelona. The consistently exceptional food and inviting ambiance make every visit enjoyable. It's a must-try for anyone seeking a delightful dining experience in the city.

name: Iaia Cristina
review_1:
A very cute little restaurant with excellent food. I visited in June and loved it. I especially recommend the pasta Iaia Christina because it was really delicious. We stayed at a nearby hotel and ate there almost every day.

As a wheelchair user I found it semi accessible because the bathroom was not accessible with the wheelchair but it wasn't a big issue for me because my hotel was right around the corner but maybe keep that in mind.
review_2: Amazing place with great food. There's no chance you can find better goat cheese salad in Barcelona. The pasta with truffles is also amazing. The service is top-notch. I highly recommend this place for a good food and great mood.
review_3:
Definitely one of the best restaurants I've been around the world !
The warmth of the space and owner is something unique.
The Capriciosa pizza was really good !
The Bruschetta was also amazing!
review_4: Very fast and prompt service. The entrecote was delicious, same as the goat cheese salad. The waiter speaks three or four different languages and I was very impressed with what a good personality he had in at least three of them.
review_5:
I took bresaola and pasta. Product are very fresh and cooked amazingly.
Real italian food

name: Four Corners
review_1: I visited the place for a breakfast and for dinner and I can tell that it is amazing. The staff is extremely polite, friendly and positive. The atmosphere is great with chill music. Let‚Äôs not forget the food - I liked everything that I‚Äôve tried.Thank you guys for the nice experience! I will visit you again!
review_2: Great place to grab a bite after some shopping nearby or after visiting the agbar tower. We ordered the burrata and mortadela pizza in small size and was more than enough for two. Great detroit style pizza. We also ordered a very tasty entry and even though the sangria was not on the menu they made an exception and it was very good size, fresh and tasted great! We also had the tiramissu for dessert. The atmosphere is great and music is not too loud, very pleasant, besides the venue is super pretty on the inside too. We had great service by the italian Giacomo which was super welcoming to us with a pet and also provided lots of attention all night. I def recommend this place.
review_3:
Service and atmosphere are too notch. The host remembers my name and always has a warm greeting.

The interior of the space is bright, welcoming and well lay out. Seating is comfortable. I really love how the slave was designed.

The pizza is good. I wish it was heated a bit more to warm up the pizza better. Pepperoni pizza for the win. The homemade lemonade is great. Ate pizza a couple time during my stay.

I tried both the breakfast buffet and a la cart option. If you're not hungry, go a la cart as it may work out to be a cheaper meal. The sourdough bread with pear, walnut and honey is a perfect light way to start your day.

The orange juice is great... mix OJ and grapefruit together for your morning mix  The fruit has a great selection and was tasty and fresh. The bacon is cooked to long, imo. I like my bacon less crunchy and more chewy. It tasted good still and ate more than I should. The sausage was great and I ate a few of those. The cranberries loaf wasn't for me.

Eggs are tasty. They were sold out of some croissants during my stay which means I couldn't taste them. Buffet breakfast is nice but only makes sense if someone is super hungry to get value for money.
review_4:
Went to Four Corners twice and loved it. It‚Äôs a great pizza which is quite difficult to find in Barcelona as it‚Äôs not a traditional or napolitan style pizza. It‚Äôs on a focaccia dough and with a lot of good quality toppings.
Also the place is super trendy and fun, good music and staff works well, totally recommend this place.
review_5: Nice pizza, nice location, friendly polite staff. Recommended.

name: Cucina Italiana Restaurante - Bar H
review_1: Small family restaurant with absolutely delicious food and everything is made from high quality ingredients. The carbonara is made perfectly and you can taste the authenticity. The tiramisu was also amazing. Ask them for reccomendations you will not be disappointed!
review_2: If I could give 10 stars I would. Owner is incredibly nice, speaks some English, and has the best fresh pasta I‚Äôve ever had. I lived in Rome for awhile and hands down this is the best pasta. Molto bene!!
review_3: I ordered a cuatro quesos pasta. It was not al dente but simply undercooked. The cheese sauce also disappointed me because it was not thick, but liquid like water. So couldn‚Äôt finish. The service is good. The food is overrated
review_4: Mixed feelings about this one. Upon coming here, it felt a bit that to the waitress, customers were more of an annoyance than pleasure, but she did her job well, even in English. To the food ‚Äì the Italian unfiltered beer was great, foccacia tasted decent, and the pasta... well, according to the reviews, we anticipated an amazing experience. In reality, we received two plates of pasta so al-dente it could be considered undercooked (and therefore not tasting great). As for the sauces, the Arrabiata was outstanding, but the Carbonara felt somewhat off. Overall, the value for the food is still great, but some things leave a lot to be desired.
review_5:
Simple, but amazing comfort food. Has Italian beer and the Italian coffee is just one euro. The place doesn't look amazing but the food tastes like something you would eat in Italy.

2023 edit: still has amazing food, prices went up but the quality stayed the same. You can still get a good plate of fresh pasta for 7.5‚Ç¨ and 2.5‚Ç¨ for each slice of a focaccia, highly recommended!

name: GastropizzeriaToscana
editorial_review: Compact restaurant dishing up pizza, pasta & other Italian classics in unfussy surrounds.
review_1: Casual Italian Joint for a quick meal. The food portions are generous and decently priced. The assistance offered was promptly and informative.
review_2: Less than average. I got spinach ravioli with four "cheese" sauce. The ravioli had almost no filling and it wasn't even spinach. The plate was 75% sauce and it was this weird white cream stuff that didn't taste at all like cheese. The seating setup is terrible and cramped and the staff seem annoyed when you walk it the door. I only went here because it was close to my hostel but don't bother.
review_3: Food was good when it eventually came, the service was very slow. I saw many Delivery people picking up food, so I think delivery is prioritised over people dinning in.
review_4: We were three people and all liked it. The pizza was very good. The cheap wine also! :) Better don't order desert. Not bad, but average at best
review_5: Great Pizza, great Meals  and absolutely great Staff, awesome food. Just needs a kids menu . Food is great tho.

name: Mammamia
editorial_review: Low-key, compact eatery featuring Neapolitan pizza, pasta & other Italian specialties.
review_1: Great service and amazing food! If you want to find true Italian food, this place is a must! Would highly recommend! Price is reasonable too!
review_2: Great italian cuisine restaurant located close to the subway station in Poblenou. I loved the interior decoration, which is rustic and cozy. The staff is very friendly and attentive. They found a table for us in no time. The dishes are delicious and the portions are more than enough. There's a good variety of pizzas to choose from. The price is a bit higher than the average, but it is reasonable due to the amount and quality of the food. Overall, the service quality was good. I'd like to come back to try other dishes!
review_3:
üçï It is a good place for pizza lovers. This place delivered a tasty, beautiful and rich calzone, particularly impressing with its delightful dough (7/10)

üíÅüèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è  While the service was nice, the pace was a bit slow. Waiting almost 20 minutes, even with the place being half-empty (6/10)

‚öúÔ∏è Quite big place, a lot of tables, also has small patio outside (7/10)

7/10
review_4:
Small and humble place outside the main street with delicious neapolitan (soft dough) pizzas. Probably the best pizzas in Poblenou. Very good prices and nice staff. They have pasta and other traditional Italian staples as well, but I haven't had the pleasure to taste them yet.

My favourite pizza is the "cabrona". Delicious! Their tiramisu is really good as well. Definitely worth a try.
review_5: This place is warm and has a great climate. I would say they saved us :) The baby that didn't want to eat anything elase and was happy with the penne bolognese they served. I totally falled in love with the tiramisu. We also had pizza and buratta salad and all was awesome. Kids loved to observe how pizza was done :)

name: Don Vitto Restaurante y Pizzer√≠a
review_1: It may look very small and sketchy, but we were left shocked. The service was fabulous, everyone was friendly, helpful and especially sincere. There are no words that can describe how delicious the food was. The pasta and pizza was just like from Italy. The flavours just melted in our mouths. The place was authentic and cozy. Take this review seriously, as we are from Lithuania. Definitely recommend‚ù§Ô∏è
review_2: We live close but have never visited before tonight. We had visitors and came as a family of 5, we didn‚Äôt have a booking but were accommodated inside quickly. We shared pizza rolls and salads to start, both were excellent. We all had pizza or lasagna and all the choices were very good baked in the wood oven. Service was quick and friendly and helpful. Thank you.
review_3: Love love love. The pasta was perfectly cooked and tasted just like being in Italy! Will be retuning as soon as I can, the service was amazing and they were so all so kind and inviting.
review_4: Very tasty pasta (spaghetti al nero con funghi), quality and quantity. Would definitely come back and try some other dishes.
review_5:
The starters were great, we had calamari and croquettes.

The pizzas were terrible unfortunately. The dough was good but barely any tomato flavour, and far too much low quality cheese. It got to the point where we had to scrape it off.

Service was fine :)

name: Locanda del Vulture
review_1:
The dinner we had was amazing, the service was excellent, what else would you need? Food was as authentic as it gets, best Italian food both of us had eaten so far (and we‚Äôve both been in Italy before). This was our second time here, (we‚Äôve been here for only 3 days, and we are going to come here for 3rd and maybe 4th time before we leave on Friday üòÇ) first time we had pizzas and they were Napoli-style pizzas which were amazing, this second time we had pasta - my girlfriend took the pappardelle en forma de parmesano (best pasta she‚Äôs had ever) and I had ragu which was excellent as well.

We also got complimentary bruschettas and shots of limoncello! See you soon!
review_2: Nice Italian food restaurant. My colleagues and I have gone there a couple of times to try their menu and it has been good so far, there's a good variety of tasty dishes. The portions are big enough. The place is always a bit crowded so make sure to either arrive early or reserve a table. The interior decoration is modern, elegant and  cozy. The staff is friendly and the owner is lovely and usually gives us a free shot at the end. The price seems fair to me. Overall, the service quality was great and I'd love to return and try more dishes.
review_3: the food was great! we definitely recommend the pasta in the parmesan! this is made at your table :) the host was also great and let us stir in the big ball of cheese, top service! we enjoyed very much!
review_4:
This place is a must to go and enjoy a fabulous lunch or dinner!
The food and service are excellent!!
Ali gave us the best service and the food was amazing!
review_5: Inside the neighborhood, a restaurant with fine Italian cuisine.  The service was very attentive, the dishes very tasty.  Grilled salmon on vegetables in the offer of the day was very good.  The mozzarella salad was as good as it should be.  For the tiramisu dessert, which was a little less tangy than I expected, the chocolate syrup on the dish was unnecessary.  Limoncello at the expense of the house was an excellent finish.

name: Marea Restaurant
review_1:
we decided to try out the new italian place in the neighborhood and it turned out to be a real disappointment.

food is rather bad (ordered tomato bruschetta, salad and seafood pasta, all tastes so-so or has no taste at all), wine selection is quite weak and there is no atmosphere.

service is good though, that‚Äôs why we give it 2 stars, not 1.
better avoid anyways
review_2: Had the loveliest of meals here. We had Pizza, tapas and lovely cold beer. Service was fantastic and they helped us pick out different tapas to try. Definitely a little gem and should not be passed by.
review_3: The food and drinks are so good. Go there now before it becomes popular.  They have only been open a short while.  Probably the best Tartar de Atun I have ever had. We went there twice and would have gone three times but they are closed on Mondays.
review_4: It is the first time that I have lunch here at Marea and I must say that it has exceeded my expectations ... and the tiramisu ü§§ü§§ü§§delicious ... All accompanied by an extraordinary service that makes you feel at home .. Thanks üôè
review_5: Found when looking for food after the beach and glad we found this lovely restaurant, food was great and the cocktails were fabulous. Service was fantastic, would go back the next we go to Barcelona.

name: Il Birrino
review_1: 10/10!!!! We were not sure if we wanted to have Italian food in Spain, but definitely worth it! Delicious food; I recommend squid spaghetti with all my heart. Also very good beers. Reservation required.
review_2: Small portions and big price. Never have I seen a pasta with shrimp in which they cut up the shrimp into small portions. This is a way to use less ingredients. Also ordered ravioli and only got 6 pieces. 13.50 for 6 pieces? This is not a main course. Had to go to another place to eat afterwards because even after spending 40 euro, we were still hungry. Skip this place.
review_3: Authentic italian restaurant. When we got there, they had just open and I could see the chef making the pasta, which is something you don't see that often in Barcelona, especially not for the price we paid here (aprox 12 eur / plate). The mozarella was exquisite as well. The place is small and simply decorated, good for casual meals with friends.
review_4: Luckily I live really close to Il Birrino and I have been able to try a few dishes. The panino con la porchetta is just supreme! If you like pork and focaccia, this sandwich is a dream. The owner is also really nice and explains what each dish has before you make a decision. A must if you are in Barcelona.
review_5: This is a small, neighborhood restaurant with really good food and outstanding service.  I recommend the specials. Tha carpaccio was an excellent starter.
